title.value: Intel graphical interface - problem and solution

body.value:
If you have a computer with an Intel graphical interface there is a free tool by Intel Graphics for Linux: https://01.org/linuxgraphics/ or the download area https://01.org/linuxgraphics/downloads
If an Intel graphic chip â†’ open Firefox and open https://01.org/linuxgraphics/downloads Depending on the Ubuntu release (version and 64 or 32 Bit) download the matching tool release, see link in the list https://download.01.org/gfx/ubuntu/14.04/main/pool/main/i/intel-linux-graphics-installer/intel-linux-graphics-installer_1.0.7-0intel1_amd64.deb
A windows will open, just press Enter (open with gdebi-gtk (default) --> a new windows open --> confirm --> Install Package --> Enter Admin passwort "labdoo" (or what password you are using) --> Wait, when finished, close window Click on the Ubuntu Icon left upper corner --> type Intel and click on the Intel software shown below --> Enter Admin password --> Intell graphic tool will start --> Begin --> Install (will last a while...) --> each step will be confirmed with a green ok (hopefully) --> if installation is finished the laptop has to be restarted.
